markdownRemark.html:
At Sāvatthī.

“Mendicants, dragons reproduce in these four ways. What four? Dragons are born from eggs, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously. These are the four ways that dragons reproduce.”

SN.29.2. Paṇītatarasutta (“Better”)

Dragons are born from eggs, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.
These are the four ways that dragons reproduce.”
